meeting_annotations.speaker: Ronit Freeman
meeting_annotations.transcript: I also want to maybe suggest another or an additional role for the crosstalk is I think it's it's not just there it's essential for the cell to be able to respond dynamically to to a sudden change right. So if there's no crosstalk there's not like a gauge mechanism right or for the cell to say oh now I need to do this and then I'm coming back to some type of a homeostasis and then oh I have to do this right. There have to be these crosstalks for the cell to to respond and respond in a in a fast time scale. So I think not only the crosstalk is not noise but it's an essential component of the ability of the cell to process multiple or respond to multiple events at once.
